titleStmt.title: Mikrokosmographia, or, A description of the body of man being a practical anatomy, shevving the manner of anatomizing from part to part, the like hath not been set forth in the English tongue : adorned with many demonstrative figures / long since composed in Latine by that famous J. Berengarius of Carpus, Dr. of A. & P., reader of chirurgery in the University of Bononia ; done into English by H. Jackson, chirurgeon, by whom is also added a fit Etymon to the names of the parts in their proper place.
titleStmt.author: Berengario da Carpi, Jacopo, ca. 1460-ca. 1530.

titleStmt.title: Mikrokosmographia, or, A description of the body of man being a practical anatomy, shevving the manner of anatomizing from part to part, the like hath not been set forth in the English tongue : adorned with many demonstrative figures / long since composed in Latine by that famous J. Berengarius of Carpus, Dr. of A. & P., reader of chirurgery in the University of Bononia ; done into English by H. Jackson, chirurgeon, by whom is also added a fit Etymon to the names of the parts in their proper place.
titleStmt.author: Berengario da Carpi, Jacopo, ca. 1460-ca. 1530.

notesStmt.note: First word of title in Greek characters.
Photostat plates of missing pages supplied by Surgeon General's Library, Washington D.C. Best copy available for photographing.
